segments.text: I notice how peaceful the garden looks through the window, but inside, everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so absorbed in her task that she doesn’t even see the water at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for cookies, and I can’t help but feel worried for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to collapse under him at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should really turn the faucet off before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out, and it’s already making a huge mess on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children seem to have no idea that they’re in any danger at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a metaphor for how easily chaos can unfold when no one is paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost feel like laughing at how ridiculous it all is, but I’m too worried for them.
segments.speaker: PAR
